channel.title: Where to?
channel.description: I totally forgot where to change maxlevel o.O Halp halp?

item.title: Where to?
item.dc:creator: @pk_blooder pk_blooder
item.description:
@pk_blooder wrote:

[quote=“ownage plz, post:6, topic:130451”][quote author=Mod Adam link=topic=181103.msg1653849#msg1653849 date=1186314942]

Lol =O player.java

Nope, client.

[code]public int getLevelForXP(int exp) {
int points = 0;
int output = 0;

	for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 99; lvl++) {
		points += Math.floor((double)lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double)lvl / 7.0));
		output = (int)Math.floor(points / 4);
		if (output >= exp) {
			return lvl;
		}
	}
	return 99;
}[/code]

There you go.
[/quote]

Umm ok not all of us stick everything in the client constructor.[/quote]

tought that void was in client and player :\

Read full topic

Lol =O player.java
[/quote]
Nope, client.

[code]public int getLevelForXP(int exp) {
int points = 0;
int output = 0;

	for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 99; lvl++) {
		points += Math.floor((double)lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double)lvl / 7.0));
		output = (int)Math.floor(points / 4);
		if (output >= exp) {
			return lvl;
		}
	}
	return 99;
}[/code]

There you go.[/quote]

Umm ok not all of us stick everything in the client constructor.

item.title: Where to?
item.dc:creator: @bakatool bakatool
item.description:
@bakatool wrote:

    public static int getLevelForXP(int exp)
    {
        int points = 0;
        int output = 0;

        for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 99; lvl++)
        {
            points += Math.floor((double)lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double)
                lvl / 7.0));
            output = (int)Math.floor(points / 4);
            if (output >= exp)
            {
                return lvl;
            }
        }
        return 99;
    }

change both 99’s to new max lvl

Read full topic

item.title: Where to?
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Adam Adam
item.description:
@Mod_Adam wrote:

ownage plz:

Lol =O player.java

Nope, client.

[code]public int getLevelForXP(int exp) {
int points = 0;
int output = 0;

	for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 99; lvl++) {
		points += Math.floor((double)lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double)lvl / 7.0));
		output = (int)Math.floor(points / 4);
		if (output >= exp) {
			return lvl;
		}
	}
	return 99;
}[/code]

There you go.
